snippet: Leaders of the two nations urged Greece to enact promised changes in the economy or risk losing the next installment of bailout money.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy urge Greece to enact promised structural changes in the economy or risk losing the next installment of bailout money; Greek Prime Min Lucas Papademos has warned that without deeper spending cuts a disorderly default is possible, and could result in Greece leaving the euro.

byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger in Paris contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Leaders of the two nations urged Greece to enact promised changes in the economy or risk losing the next installment of bailout money.

headline.seo: France and Germany Warn Greece on Bailout
headline.main: Germany and France Warn Greece on Bailout Money
headline.print_headline: Germany and France Warn Greece on Bailout Money
